column4: what is the best way to share files between two computers that are far away?
hmm - I was thinking something closer to NFS or SMB -- but I'm not sure how it would be possible to make these work from 2 different networks
afaik, both NFS and SMB were developed to provide LAN services.
do you _have_ to share files real-time or do they just need to be 'synchronized'?
right ;) well I want to store all my music and movies on my dual processor machine
what distance are we talking? meters? hops? parsecs?
LOL -- about 5 feet from me -- but I want my parents to be able to use it as well (900 miles)
so, you have a LAN and two computers, of which one is a dual-proc server and the other is a workstation.
-- sort of... but the computers each lease their own IP address from my ISP
but why don't you connect them via 2 seperate NICs? and either a switch or a x-over cable?
doesn't _have_ to cost you a fortune, you know.

but you'd get a rather large latency. And you'd be limited to <= <min isp bandwidth>/2
bandwidth is not a problem... the latency will be annoying but I will deal with it -- it'll help motivate me to learn vpn
well, if you *want* to use vpn, you'll create a share medium (logically) anyway, at which point smb or nfs *should* work anyway.
